summary: The Postal Police Reform Act of 2025 aims to modify the role and duties of United States Postal Service (USPS) police officers. It amends Title 18 of the United States Code, specifically Section 3061. Key changes include expanding the entities under consideration to include Postal Service police officers in addition to Postal Inspectors. The bill also revises regulations pertaining to USPS property, granting the Postmaster General authority to prescribe regulations for property protection and administration, including penalties for violations.
